alert.note: Alert for Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 6:59PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Oswego County through 745 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Camden to Baldwinsville. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oswego, Fulton, Central Square, Redfield, Battle Island State Park, Hastings, Scriba, Volney, Constantia, West Monroe, Palermo, New Haven, Phoenix, Minetto, Mexico, Williamstown, Cleveland, Parish, Altmar, and Amboy Center. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 32 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. The storms will have the potential to produce one to two inches of rain. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Buffalo.
